   20: -module(code_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("syntax_tools/include/merl.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   26: -export([set_path/1, get_path/1, add_path/1, add_paths/1, del_path/1,
   27: 	 replace_path/1, load_file/1, load_abs/1,
   28:          ensure_loaded/1, ensure_loaded_many/1, ensure_loaded_many_kill/1,
   29:          ensure_loaded_bad_case/1,
   30: 	 delete/1, purge/1, purge_many_exits/0, purge_many_exits/1,
   31:          soft_purge/1, is_loaded/1, all_loaded/1, all_available/1,
   32: 	 load_binary/1, dir_req/1, object_code/1, set_path_file/1,
   33: 	 upgrade/0, upgrade/1,
   34: 	 sticky_dir/1, add_del_path/1,
   35:          pa_pz_option/1, remove_pa_pz_option/1,
   36: 	 dir_disappeared/1, ext_mod_dep/1, clash/1,
   37: 	 where_is_file/1,
   38: 	 purge_stacktrace/1, mult_lib_roots/1, bad_erl_libs/1,
   39: 	 code_archive/1, code_archive2/1, on_load/1, on_load_binary/1,
   40: 	 on_load_embedded/1, on_load_errors/1, on_load_update/1,
   41:          on_load_trace_on_load/1,
   42: 	 on_load_purge/1, on_load_self_call/1, on_load_pending/1,
   43: 	 on_load_deleted/1, on_load_deadlock/1,
   44: 	 big_boot_embedded/1,
   45:          module_status/1,
   46: 	 get_mode/1, code_path_cache/1,
   47: 	 normalized_paths/1, mult_embedded_flags/1]).
   48: 
   49: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   50: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   51: 
   52: %% error_logger
   53: -export([init/1,
   54: 	 handle_event/2, handle_call/2, handle_info/2,
   55: 	 terminate/2]).
   56: 
   57: -export([compile_load/4]).
   58: 
   59: suite() ->
   60:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   61:      {timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   62: 
   63: all() ->
   64:     [set_path, get_path, add_path, add_paths, del_path,
   65:      replace_path, load_file, load_abs,
   66:      ensure_loaded, ensure_loaded_many, ensure_loaded_many_kill,
   67:      ensure_loaded_bad_case,
   68:      delete, purge, purge_many_exits, soft_purge, is_loaded, all_loaded,
   69:      all_available, load_binary, dir_req, object_code, set_path_file,
   70:      upgrade, code_path_cache,
   71:      pa_pz_option, remove_pa_pz_option,
   72:      sticky_dir, add_del_path, dir_disappeared,
   73:      ext_mod_dep, clash, where_is_file,
   74:      purge_stacktrace, mult_lib_roots,
   75:      bad_erl_libs, code_archive, code_archive2, on_load,
   76:      on_load_binary, on_load_embedded, on_load_errors,
   77:      {group, sequence},
   78:      on_load_purge, on_load_self_call, on_load_pending,
   79:      on_load_deleted, on_load_deadlock,
   80:      module_status,
   81:      big_boot_embedded, get_mode, normalized_paths,
   82:      mult_embedded_flags].
   83: 
   84: %% These need to run in order
   85: groups() -> [{sequence, [sequence], [on_load_update,
   86:                                      on_load_trace_on_load]}].
   87: 
   88: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   89: 	Config.
   90: 
   91: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   92: 	Config.
   93: 
   94: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   95:     %% The compiler will no longer create a Beam file if
   96:     %% the module name does not match the filename, so
   97:     %% we must compile to a binary and write the Beam file
   98:     %% ourselves.
   99:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  100:     File = filename:join(Dir, "code_a_test"),
  101:     {ok,code_b_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  102:     ok = file:write_file(File++".beam", Code),
  103:     Config.
  104: 
  105: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  106:     Config.
  107: 
  108: -define(TESTMOD, test_dummy).
  109: -define(TESTMODSTR, "test_dummy").
  110: -define(TESTMODSRC, ?TESTMODSTR ".erl").
  111: -define(TESTMODOBJ, ?TESTMODSTR ".beam").
  112: 
  113: init_per_testcase(big_boot_embedded, Config) ->
  114:     case catch application:start(crypto) of
  115: 	ok ->
  116: 	    init_per_testcase(do_big_boot_embedded, Config);
  117: 	_Else ->
  118: 	    {skip, "Needs crypto!"}
  119:     end;
  120: init_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config0) ->
  121:     LibRoot = code:lib_dir(),
  122:     LinkName = filename:join(LibRoot, "on_load_app-1.0"),
  123:     Config = [{link_name,LinkName}|Config0],
  124:     init_per_testcase(Config);
  125: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  126:     init_per_testcase(Config).
  127: 
  128: init_per_testcase(Config) ->
  129:     P = code:get_path(),
  130:     [{code_path, P}|Config].
  131: 
  132: 
  133: end_per_testcase(module_status, Config) ->
  134:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  135:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  136:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  137:     file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ),
  138:     file:delete(?TESTMODSRC),
  139:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  140: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == mult_lib_roots;
  141: 				  TC == big_boot_embedded ->
  142:     {ok, HostName} = inet:gethostname(),
  143:     NodeName = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(TC)++"@"++HostName),
  144:     test_server:stop_node(NodeName),
  145:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  146: end_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config) ->
  147:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
  148:     _ = del_link(LinkName),
  149:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  150: end_per_testcase(upgrade, Config) ->
  151:     %% Make sure tracing is turned off even if the test times out.
  152:     erlang:trace_pattern({error_handler,undefined_function,3}, false, [global]),
  153:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
  154:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  155: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  156:     end_per_testcase(Config).
  157: 
  158: end_per_testcase(Config) ->
  159:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  160:     P=proplists:get_value(code_path, Config),
  161:     true=code:set_path(P),
  162:     P=code:get_path(),
  163:     ok.
  164: 
  165: set_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  166:     P = code:get_path(),
  167:     NonExDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), test_server:temp_name("hej")),
  168:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:set_path({a})),
  169:     {error, bad_directory} = (catch code:set_path([{a}])),
  170:     {error, bad_directory} = code:set_path(NonExDir),
  171:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  172:     true = code:set_path(P), % set the same path again.
  173:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  174:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  175:     true = code:set_path([LibDir | P]),
  176:     [LibDir | P] = code:get_path(),
  177:     true = code:set_path([LibDir]),
  178:     [LibDir] = code:get_path(),
  179:     ok.
  180: 
  181: get_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  182:     P = code:get_path(),
  183:     %% test that all directories are strings (lists).
  184:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  185: 	    (Dir) when is_list(Dir) -> false;
  186: 	    (_) -> true
  187: 	end, P),
  188:     ok.
  189: 
  190: add_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  191:     P = code:get_path(),
  192:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_path({})),
  193:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_patha({})),
  194:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_pathz({})),
  195:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_path("xyz"),
  196:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_patha("xyz"),
  197:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_pathz("xyz"),
  198:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  199:     true = code:add_path(LibDir),
  200:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  201:     code:set_path(P),
  202:     true = code:add_pathz(LibDir),
  203:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  204:     code:set_path(P),
  205:     true = code:add_patha(LibDir),
  206:     [LibDir|_] = code:get_path(),
  207:     code:set_path(P),
  208:     ok.
  209: 
  210: add_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  211:     P = code:get_path(),
  212:     ok = code:add_paths([{}]),
  213:     ok = code:add_pathsa([{}]),
  214:     ok = code:add_pathsz([{}]),
  215:     ok = code:add_paths(["xyz"]),
  216:     ok = code:add_pathsa(["xyz"]),
  217:     ok = code:add_pathsz(["xyz"]),
  218:     P = code:get_path(), % check that no directory is added.
  219: 
  220:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  221:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir]),
  222:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  223:     code:set_path(P),
  224:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir]),
  225:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  226:     code:set_path(P),
  227:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir]),
  228:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  229:     code:set_path(P),
  230: 
  231:     RootDir = code:root_dir(),
  232:     Res = P ++ [LibDir, RootDir],
  233:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, RootDir]),
  234:     Res = code:get_path(),
  235:     code:set_path(P),
  236:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, RootDir]),
  237:     Res = code:get_path(),
  238:     code:set_path(P),
  239:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, RootDir]),
  240:     [RootDir, LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  241:     code:set_path(P),
  242: 
  243:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  244:     Res1 = P ++ [LibDir],
  245:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  246:     code:set_path(P),
  247:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  248:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  249:     code:set_path(P),
  250:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  251:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  252:     code:set_path(P),
  253:     ok.
  254: 
  255: del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  256:     P = code:get_path(),
  257:     try
  258: 	del_path_1(P)
  259:     after
  260: 	code:set_path(P)
  261:     end.
  262: 
  263: del_path_1(P) ->
  264:     io:format("Initial code:get_path()=~p~n",[P]),
  265:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:del_path(3)),
  266:     false = code:del_path(my_dummy_name),
  267:     false = code:del_path("/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  268:     Dir = filename:join([code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin"]),
  269:     io:format("kernel dir: ~p~n",[Dir]),
  270: 
  271:     true = code:del_path(kernel),
  272:     NewP = code:get_path(),
  273:     io:format("Path after removing 'kernel':~p~n",[NewP]),
  274:     ReferenceP = lists:delete(Dir,P),
  275:     io:format("Reference path:~p~n",[ReferenceP]),
  276:     NewP = ReferenceP, % check that dir is deleted
  277:     code:set_path(P),
  278: 
  279:     %% An superfluous "/" should also work.
  280:     true = code:del_path("kernel/"),
  281:     NewP = ReferenceP,			   % check that dir is deleted
  282:     code:set_path(P),
  283: 
  284:     true = code:del_path(Dir),
  285:     NewP1 = code:get_path(),
  286:     NewP1 = lists:delete(Dir,P), % check that dir is deleted
  287:     ok.
  288: 
  289: replace_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  290:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  291:     P = code:get_path(),
  292:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:replace_path(3,"")),
  293:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(dummy_name,""),
  294:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  295: 						"/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  296:     {error, bad_directory} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  297: 						     "/kdlk/kernel-1.2"),
  298:     P = code:get_path(), % Check that path is not changed.
  299: 
  300:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  301: 
  302:     %% Replace an existing application.
  303: 
  304:     file:make_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  305:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  306:     NewDir = Cwd ++ "/kernel-2.11",
  307:     true = code:replace_path(kernel, NewDir),
  308:     NewDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  309:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  310:     ok = file:del_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  311: 
  312:     %% Add a completely new application.
  313: 
  314:     NewAppName = 'blurf_blarfer',
  315:     NewAppDir = filename:join(Cwd, atom_to_list(NewAppName) ++ "-6.33.1"),
  316:     ok = file:make_dir(NewAppDir),
  317:     true = code:replace_path(NewAppName, NewAppDir),
  318:     NewAppDir = code:lib_dir(NewAppName),
  319:     NewAppDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  320:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  321:     ok = file:del_dir(NewAppDir),
  322: 
  323:     ok.
  324: 
  325: code_path_cache(Config) ->
  326:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  327: 
  328:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
  329:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
  330:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  331:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  332: 
  333:     Original = code:get_path(),
  334:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "myebin"),
  335:     filelib:ensure_path(Dir),
  336:     ToBeReplacedDir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-1/ebin"),
  337:     ToBeReplacedDir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-2/ebin"),
  338:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  339:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir2),
  340: 
  341:     File = filename:join(Dir, ?TESTMODOBJ),
  342:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
  343: 
  344:     %% Adding a cached path and re-adding for clearing
  345:     [begin
  346:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  347:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  348:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  349:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  350:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  351:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  352:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  353:         code:del_path(Dir),
  354:         ok = file:delete(File)
  355:      end || Fun <- [add_path, add_patha, add_pathz]],
  356: 
  357:     Original = code:get_path(),
  358: 
  359:     %% Adding several cached paths and explicit cache clearing
  360:     [begin
  361:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  362:         ok = code:Fun([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1], cache),
  363:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  364:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  365:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  366:         ok = code:clear_cache(),
  367:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  368:         ok = code:del_paths([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1]),
  369:         ok = file:delete(File)
  370:      end || Fun <- [add_paths, add_pathsa, add_pathsz]],
  371: 
  372:     Original = code:get_path(),
  373: 
  374:     %% Replacing a non-cached path with cache and set_path for clearing
  375:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  376:     true = code:add_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  377:     true = code:replace_path(tobereplaced, ToBeReplacedDir2, cache),
  378:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  379:     ok = file:write_file(filename:join(ToBeReplacedDir2, ?TESTMODOBJ), Bin),
  380:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  381:     true = code:set_path(code:get_path(), nocache),
  382:     {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  383: 
  384:     true = code:set_path(Original),
  385:     ok.
  386: 
  387: %% OTP-3977.
  388: dir_disappeared(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  389:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  390:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "temp"),
  391:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  392:     true = code:add_path(Dir),
  393:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  394:     non_existing = code:which(bubbelskrammel),
  395:     ok.
  396: 
  397: load_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     {error, nofile} = code:load_file(duuuumy_mod),
  399:     {error, badfile} = code:load_file(code_a_test),
  400:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_file(123)),
  401:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  402:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  403:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  404:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  405:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: test_dir() ->
  409:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
  410: 
  411: load_abs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  412:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  413:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/duuuumy_mod"),
  414:     {error, badfile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_a_test"),
  415:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_abs({})),
  416:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs("Non-latin-имя-файла"),
  417:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  418:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  419:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  420:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  421:     ok.
  422: 
  423: ensure_loaded_bad_case(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  424:     %% Make sure loading an invalid .beam file does
  425:     %% not hold a permanent lock on the server.
  426:     {error, _} = code:ensure_loaded('STRING'),
  427:     {error, _} = code:ensure_loaded('STRING'),
  428:     ok.
  429: 
  430: ensure_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  431:     {module, lists} = code:ensure_loaded(lists),
  432:     case init:get_argument(mode) of
  433: 	{ok, [["embedded"] | _]} ->
  434: 	    {error, embedded} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  435: 	    {error, badarg} = code:ensure_loaded(34),
  436: 	    ok;
  437: 	_ ->
  438: 	    {error, nofile} = code:ensure_loaded(duuuumy_mod),
  439: 	    {error, badfile} = code:ensure_loaded(code_a_test),
  440: 	    {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:ensure_loaded(34)),
  441: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  442: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  443: 	    ok
  444:     end.
  445: 
  446: ensure_loaded_many(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  447:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  448:         %% Without special handling for async loading in code server,
  449:         %% this operation seemed to consistently take 5s+
  450:         Action = fun() ->
  451:             Self = self(),
  452:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  453:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  454:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  455:             ok
  456:         end,
  457:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []], 1_000)
  458:     end).
  459: 
  460: ensure_loaded_many_kill(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  461:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  462:         Action = fun() ->
  463:             Self = self(),
  464:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  465:             sys:suspend(code_server),
  466:             First = spawn_opt(Fun, [{priority, max}]),
  467:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  468:             sys:resume(code_server),
  469:             exit(First, kill),
  470:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  471:             {file, _} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  472:             ok
  473:         end,
  474:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []])
  475:     end).
  476: 
  477: with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, Fun) ->
  478:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  479:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  480:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [fun set_up_large_loadpath/1, [Priv]]),
  481:     try Fun(Node)
  482:     after peer:stop(Peer)
  483:     end.
  484: 
  485: set_up_large_loadpath(Priv) ->
  486:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  487:     Dirs = [filename:join(Priv, integer_to_list(N)) || N <- lists:seq(1, 500)],
  488:     [ok = filelib:ensure_path(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  489:     [true = code:add_patha(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  490:     ok.
  491: 
  492: delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  493:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  494:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  495:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  496:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  497:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:delete(122)),
  498:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  499:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  500:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  501:     exit(Pid,kill),
  502:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  503:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  504:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  505:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  506:     ok.
  507: 
  508: purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  509:     run_purge_test(fun purge_test/1, Config).
  510: 
  511: purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  512:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  513:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  514:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  515:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  516:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  517:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  518:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  519:     true = code:purge(code_b_test),
  520:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  521:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  522:     ok.
  523: 
  524: purge_many_exits() ->
  525:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
  526: 
  527: purge_many_exits(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  528:     run_purge_test(fun purge_many_exits_test/1, Config).
  529: 
  530: purge_many_exits_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  531:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  532: 
  533:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  534:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  535: 
  536:     CodePurgeF = fun(M, Exp) -> Exp = code:purge(M) end,
  537:     purge_many_exits_do(CodePurgeF),
  538: 
  539:     %% Let's repeat test for erlang:purge_module as it does the same thing
  540:     %% now in erts-8.0 (except for return value).
  541:     ErlangPurgeF = fun(M, _Exp) -> erlang:purge_module(M) end,
  542:     purge_many_exits_do(ErlangPurgeF),
  543: 
  544:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  545:     ok.
  546: 
  547: 
  548: purge_many_exits_do(PurgeF) ->
  549:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  550:     TPids = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  551: 			      {code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  552: 			       spawn_link(fun () ->
  553: 						  receive
  554: 						  after infinity -> ok
  555: 						  end
  556: 					  end)}
  557: 			 end,
  558: 			 lists:seq(1, 1000)),
  559:     %% Give them time to start...
  560:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  561:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  562:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  563: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  564: 			  false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  565: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2)
  566: 		  end, TPids),
  567:     PurgeF(code_b_test, true),
  568:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  569: 			  false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  570: 			  true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  571: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2),
  572: 			  exit(Pid2, kill)
  573: 		  end, TPids),
  574:     lists:foreach(fun ({_Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  575: 			  receive {'EXIT', Pid2, _} -> ok end
  576: 		  end, TPids).
  577: 
  578: 
  579: soft_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  580:     run_purge_test(fun soft_purge_test/1, Config).
  581: 
  582: soft_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  583:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  584:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  585:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:soft_purge(23)),
  586:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  587:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  588:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  589:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  590:     false = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  591:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  592:     exit(Pid,kill),
  593:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  594:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  595:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  596:     ok.
  597: 
  598: is_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  599:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  600:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  601:     false = code:is_loaded(duuuuuumy_mod),
  602:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:is_loaded(23)),
  603:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(init),
  604:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  605:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  606:     {file, _Loaded} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  607:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  608:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  609:     ok.
  610: 
  611: all_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  612:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  613: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  614: 	false -> all_loaded_1()
  615:     end.
  616: 
  617: all_loaded_1() ->
  618:     Preloaded = [{M,preloaded} || M <- lists:sort(erlang:pre_loaded())],
  619: 
  620:     Loaded0 = lists:sort(code:all_loaded()),
  621:     all_unique(Loaded0),
  622:     Loaded1 = lists:keysort(2, Loaded0),
  623:     Loaded2 = match_and_remove(Preloaded, Loaded1),
  624: 
  625:     ObjExt = code:objfile_extension(),
  626:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  627: 	    ({Mod,AbsName}) when is_atom(Mod), is_list(AbsName) ->
  628: 		Mod =/= list_to_atom(filename:basename(AbsName, ObjExt));
  629: 	    (_) -> true
  630: 	end, Loaded2),
  631:     ok.
  632: 
  633: match_and_remove([], List) -> List;
  634: match_and_remove([X|T1], [X|T2]) -> match_and_remove(T1, T2).
  635: 
  636: all_unique([]) -> ok;
  637: all_unique([_]) -> ok;
  638: all_unique([{X,_}|[{Y,_}|_]=T]) when X < Y -> all_unique(T).
  639: 
  640: all_available(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  641:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  642: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  643: 	false -> all_available_1(Config)
  644:     end.
  645: 
  646: all_available_1(Config) ->
  647: 
  648:     %% Add an ez dir to make sure the modules in there are found
  649:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)++"clash/",
  650:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  651: 
  652:     Available = code:all_available(),
  653: 
  654:     %% Test that baz and blarg that are part of the .ez archive are found
  655:     {value, _} =
  656:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not Loaded andalso Name =:= "baz" end, Available),
  657:     {value, _} =
  658:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not Loaded andalso Name =:= "blarg" end, Available),
  659: 
  660:     %% Test that all loaded are part of all available
  661:     Loaded = [{atom_to_list(M),P,true} || {M,P} <- code:all_loaded()],
  662:     [] = Loaded -- Available,
  663: 
  664:     {value, {ModStr,_,false} = NotLoaded} =
  665:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not is_atom(Name) end, Available),
  666:     ct:log("Testing with ~p",[NotLoaded]),
  667: 
  668:     Mod = list_to_atom(ModStr),
  669: 
  670:     %% Test that the module is actually not loaded
  671:     false = code:is_loaded(Mod),
  672: 
  673:     %% Load it
  674:     Mod:module_info(),
  675: 
  676:     {value, {ModStr,_,true}} =
  677:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,_}) -> Name =:= ModStr end, code:all_available()),
  678: 
  679:     ok.
  680: 
  681: load_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  682:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  683:     File = TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  684:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  685:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(12, File, Bin)),
  686:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, 12, Bin)),
  687:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, 12)),
  688:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  689:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  690:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  691:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  692:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  693:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  694:     ok.
  695: 
  696: 
  697: upgrade() ->
  698:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
  699: 
  700: upgrade(Config) ->
  701:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  702:     upgrade_do(DataDir, beam, [beam]),
  703:     ok.
  704: 
  705: upgrade_do(DataDir, Client, T) ->
  706:     compile_load(upgrade_client, DataDir, undefined, Client),
  707:     [upgrade_client:run(DataDir, U1, U2, O1, O2)
  708:      || U1<-T, U2<-T, O1<-T, O2<-T],
  709:     ok.
  710: 
  711: compile_load(Mod, Dir, Ver, CodeType) ->
  712:     %%erlang:display({"{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{Loading",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  713:     Version = case Ver of
  714: 	undefined ->
  715: 	    io:format("Compiling '~p' as ~p\n", [Mod, CodeType]),
  716: 	    [];
  717: 	_ ->
  718: 	    io:format("Compiling version ~p of '~p' as ~p\n",
  719: 		[Ver, Mod, CodeType]),
  720: 	    [{d,list_to_atom("VERSION_" ++ integer_to_list(Ver))}]
  721:     end,
  722: 
  723:     CompOpts = [binary, report] ++ Version,
  724: 
  725:     Src = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  726:     T1 = erlang:now(),
  727:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(Src, CompOpts),
  728:     T2 = erlang:now(),
  729:     ObjFile = filename:basename(Src,".erl") ++ ".beam",
  730:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
  731:     T3 = erlang:now(),
  732:     io:format("Compile time ~p ms, Load time ~p ms\n",
  733: 	      [timer:now_diff(T2,T1) div 1000, timer:now_diff(T3,T2) div 1000]),
  734:     %%erlang:display({"}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}Loaded",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  735:     ok.
  736: 
  737: dir_req(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  738:     {ok,[[Root0]]} = init:get_argument(root),
  739:     Root = filename:join([Root0]),	% Normalised form.
  740:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  741:     LibDir = Root ++ "/lib",
  742:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  743:     code:compiler_dir(),
  744:     {error, bad_name} = code:lib_dir(duuumy),
  745:     KernLib = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  746:     Priv = KernLib ++ "/priv",
  747:     Priv = code:priv_dir(kernel),
  748:     {error, bad_name} = code:priv_dir(duuumy),
  749:     ok.
  750: 
  751: object_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  752:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  753:     P = code:get_path(),
  754:     P = code:get_path(),
  755:     code:add_path(TestDir),
  756:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  757:     LoadedFile = filename:absname(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++
  758: 				  code:objfile_extension()),
  759:     case code:get_object_code(code_b_test) of
  760: 	      {code_b_test,Bin,LoadedFile} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  761: 		  ok
  762: 	  end,
  763:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  764:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  765:     error = code:get_object_code(dddddddduuuuuuumy),
  766:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:get_object_code(23)),
  767:     code:set_path(P),
  768:     P=code:get_path(),
  769:     ok.
  770: 
  771: %% Test that set_path does not accept
  772: %% files as pathnames (known previous bug)
  773: set_path_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  774:     File=filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "testfil"),
  775:     ok=file:write_file(File, list_to_binary("lite data")),
  776:     {error, bad_directory}=code:set_path([File]).
  777: 
  778: %% Test that a module with the same name as a module in
  779: %% a sticky directory cannot be loaded.
  780: sticky_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  781:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  782:     Mods = [code,lists,erlang,init],
  783:     OutDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), sticky_dir),
  784:     _ = file:make_dir(OutDir),
  785:     Ret = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply,
  786: 		   [fun sticky_compiler/2,[Mods,OutDir]]),
  787:     case Ret of
  788: 	[] ->
  789: 	    ok;
  790: 	Other ->
  791: 	    io:format("~p\n", [Other]),
  792: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  793:     end,
  794:     peer:stop(Peer),
  795:     ok.
  796: 
  797: sticky_compiler(Files, PrivDir) ->
  798:     code:add_patha(PrivDir),
  799:     Rets = [do_sticky_compile(F, PrivDir) || F <- Files],
  800:     [R || R <- Rets, R =/= ok].
  801: 
  802: do_sticky_compile(Mod, Dir) ->
  803:     case code:is_sticky(Mod) of
  804:         true ->
  805:             %% Make sure that the module is loaded. A module being sticky
  806:             %% only prevents it from begin reloaded, not from being loaded
  807:             %% from the wrong place to begin with.
  808:             Mod = Mod:module_info(module),
  809:             File = filename:append(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod)),
  810:             Src = io_lib:format("-module(~s).\n"
  811:                                 "-export([test/1]).\n"
  812:                                 "test(me) -> fail.\n", [Mod]),
  813:             ok = file:write_file(File++".erl", Src),
  814:             case c:c(File, [{outdir,Dir}]) of
  815:                 {ok,Module} ->
  816:                     Module:test(me);
  817:                 {error,sticky_directory} ->
  818:                     ok
  819:             end;
  820:         false ->
  821:             %% For some reason the module is not sticky
  822:             %% could be that the .erlang file has
  823:             %% unstuck it?
  824:             {Mod, is_not_sticky}
  825:     end.
  826: 
  827: %% Test that the -pa and -pz options work as expected.
  828: pa_pz_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  829:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  830:     PaDir = filename:join(DDir,"pa"),
  831:     PzDir = filename:join(DDir,"pz"),
  832:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  833:     Ret=rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
  834:     [PaDir|Paths] = Ret,
  835:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths),
  836:     peer:stop(Peer),
  837:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-pa",
  838:         PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  839:     Ret2=rpc:call(Node2, code, get_path, []),
  840:     [PaDir|Paths2] = Ret2,
  841:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths2),
  842:     peer:stop(Peer2).
  843: 
  844: %% Test that we can remove paths added via -pa and -pz.
  845: remove_pa_pz_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  846:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  847:     PaDir = filename:join(DDir,"clash/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  848:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", PaDir]),
  849:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [blarg]),
  850:     true = rpc:call(Node, code, del_path, [PaDir]),
  851:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [blarg]),
  852:     peer:stop(Peer).
  853: 
  854: %% add_path, del_path should not cause priv_dir(App) to fail.
  855: add_del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  856:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  857:     Dir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/ebin"),
  858:     Dir2 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-2.0/ebin"),
  859:     code:add_patha(Dir1),
  860:     PrivDir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/priv"),
  861:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  862:     code:add_path(Dir2), % put last in path
  863:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  864:     code:del_path(Dir2),
  865:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  866:     ok.
  867: 
  868: 
  869: clash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  870:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)++"clash/",
  871:     P = code:get_path(),
  872: 
  873:     %% test non-clashing entries
  874: 
  875:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  876:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"zork-0.8/ebin"),
  877:     ct:capture_start(),
  878:     ok = code:clash(),
  879:     ct:capture_stop(),
  880:     [OKMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  881:     true = lists:prefix("** Found 0 name clashes", OKMsg),
  882:     true = code:set_path(P),
  883: 
  884:     %% test clashing entries
  885: 
  886:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  887:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  888:     ct:capture_start(),
  889:     ok = code:clash(),
  890:     ct:capture_stop(),
  891:     [ClashMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  892:     {match, [" hides "]} = re:run(ClashMsg, "\\*\\* .*( hides ).*",
  893: 					[{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  894:     true = code:set_path(P),
  895: 
  896:     %% test "Bad path can't read"
  897: 
  898:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  899:     TmpEzFile = Priv++"foobar-0.tmp.ez",
  900:     {ok, _} = file:copy(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez", TmpEzFile),
  901:     true = code:add_path(TmpEzFile++"/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  902:     case os:type() of
  903:         {win32,_} ->
  904: 	    %% The file won't be deleted on windows until it's closed, why we
  905: 	    %% need to rename instead.
  906: 	    ok = file:rename(TmpEzFile,TmpEzFile++".moved");
  907: 	 _ ->
  908:     	    ok = file:delete(TmpEzFile)
  909:     end,
  910:     ct:capture_start(),
  911:     ok = code:clash(),
  912:     ct:capture_stop(),
  913:     [BadPathMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  914:     true = lists:prefix("** Bad path can't read", BadPathMsg),
  915:     true = code:set_path(P),
  916:     file:delete(TmpEzFile++".moved"), %% Only effect on windows
  917:     ok.
  918: 
  919: %% Every module that the code_server uses should be preloaded,
  920: %% this test case verifies that.
  921: ext_mod_dep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  922:     xref:start(s),
  923:     xref:set_default(s, [{verbose,false},{warnings,false},
  924: 			 {builtins,true},{recurse,true}]),
  925:     xref:set_library_path(s, code:get_path()),
  926:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin")),
  927:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib),"ebin")),
  928:     case catch ext_mod_dep2() of
  929: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
  930: 	    xref:stop(s),
  931: 	    exit(Reason);
  932: 	Else ->
  933:     	    xref:stop(s),
  934: 	    case Else of
  935: 		ok -> ok;
  936: 		_ -> ct:fail(Else)
  937: 	    end
  938:     end.
  939: 
  940: ext_mod_dep2() ->
  941:     Exports0 = code_server:module_info(exports) --
  942: 	[{module_info,0},{module_info,1}],
  943:     Exports = [{code_server,M,A} || {M,A} <- Exports0],
  944:     case analyse(Exports, [], [], 0) of
  945: 	{_Visited,0} ->
  946: 	    ok;
  947: 	{_Visited,ErrCnt} ->
  948: 	    {not_verified,ErrCnt}
  949:     end.
  950: 
  951: analyse([], [], Visited, ErrCnt) ->
  952:     {Visited,ErrCnt};
  953: analyse([], [This={M,F,A}|Path], Visited, ErrCnt0) ->
  954:     %% The code_server has been granted to use the following modules,
  955:     %% These modules should be loaded by code.erl before
  956:     %% the code_server is started.
  957:     OK = [erlang, os, prim_file, erl_prim_loader, init, ets,
  958: 	  code_server, lists, lists_sort, unicode, binary, filename,
  959: 	  gb_sets, gb_trees, erts_code_purger, erts_internal, code,
  960: 	  prim_zip, zlib],
  961:     ErrCnt1 =
  962: 	case lists:member(M, OK) or erlang:is_builtin(M,F,A) of
  963: 	    true ->
  964: 		0;
  965: 	    false ->
  966: 		check_funs(This, Path)
  967: 	end,
  968:     {Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0};
  969: analyse([MFA|R], Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0) ->
  970:     case lists:member(MFA,Visited0) of
  971: 	false ->
  972: 	    {Visited,ErrCnt1} = analyse2(MFA, Path, Visited0),
  973: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0);
  974: 	true ->
  975: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0)
  976:     end.
  977: 
  978: analyse2(MFA = {'$M_EXPR',_, _}, Path, Visited0) ->
  979:     analyse([], [MFA|Path], Visited0, 0);
  980: analyse2(MFA={_,_,_}, Path, Visited0) ->
  981:     {ok, FL} = xref:analyze(s,{call,MFA}),
  982:     analyse(FL, [MFA|Path], my_usort([MFA|Visited0]), 0).
  983: 
  984: %%%% We need to check these manually...
  985: %% fun's are ok as long as they are defined locally.
  986: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  987: 	   [{unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  988: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  989: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  990: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  991: 	   [{unicode,ml_map,3},
  992: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  993: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  994: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  995: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  996: 	   [{unicode,do_o_binary2,2},
  997: 	    {unicode,do_o_binary,2},
  998: 	    {unicode,o_trans,1},
  999: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
 1000: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
 1001: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1002: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1003: 	   [{code_server,do_mod_call,4},
 1004: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1005: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1006: 	   [{lists,flatmap_1,2},
 1007: 	    {lists,flatmap,2},
 1008: 	    {lists,concat,1},
 1009: 	    {code_server,load_abs,4},
 1010: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
 1011: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1012: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1013: 	   [{lists,foreach_1,2},
 1014: 	    {lists,foreach,2},
 1015: 	    {code_server,stick_dir,3},
 1016: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
 1017: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1018: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1019: 	   [{lists,all,2},
 1020: 	    {code_server,is_numstr,1},
 1021: 	    {code_server,is_vsn,1},
 1022: 	    {code_server,vsn_to_num,1},
 1023: 	    {code_server,create_bundle,2},
 1024: 	    {code_server,choose_bundles,1},
 1025: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
 1026: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
 1027: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
 1028: 	    {code_server,init,3},
 1029: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1030: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1031: 	   [{lists,all_1,2},
 1032: 	    {lists,all,2},
 1033: 	    {code_server,is_numstr,1},
 1034: 	    {code_server,is_vsn,1},
 1035: 	    {code_server,vsn_to_num,1},
 1036: 	    {code_server,create_bundle,2},
 1037: 	    {code_server,choose_bundles,1},
 1038: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
 1039: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
 1040: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
 1041: 	    {code_server,init,3},
 1042: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1043: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1044: 	   [{lists,filter,2},
 1045: 	    {code_server,try_archive_subdirs,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1046: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1047: 	   [{erlang,apply,2},
 1048: 	    {erlang,spawn_link,1},
 1049: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1050: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1051: 	   [{erlang,spawn_link,1},{code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1052: check_funs({'$M_EXPR',warning_msg,2},
 1053: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_report,2} | _]) -> 0;
 1054: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1055: 	   [{code_server,run,2}|_]) -> 0;
 1056: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1057: 	   [{code_server,handle_on_load,5}|_]) -> 0;
 1058: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1059: 	   [{code_server,handle_pending_on_load,4}|_]) -> 0;
 1060: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1061: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_2,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1062: check_funs(This, Path) ->
 1063:     io:format("not_verified(~p, ~p)~n", [This, Path]),
 1064:     1.
 1065: 
 1066: my_usort(List) ->
 1067:     lists:reverse(uniq(lists:sort(List),[])).
 1068: 
 1069: uniq([],A) ->
 1070:     A;
 1071: uniq([H|T],[]) ->
 1072:     uniq(T,[H]);
 1073: uniq([H|T],[H|_]=A) ->
 1074:     uniq(T,A);
 1075: uniq([H|T],A) ->
 1076:     uniq(T,[H|A]).
 1077: 
 1078: 
 1079: where_is_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1080:     {T,KernelBeamFile} = timer:tc(code, where_is_file, ["kernel.beam"]),
 1081:     io:format("Load time: ~w ms~n", [T]),
 1082:     KernelEbinDir = filename:dirname(KernelBeamFile),
 1083:     AppFile = filename:join(KernelEbinDir, "kernel.app"),
 1084:     AppFile = code:where_is_file("kernel.app"),
 1085:     non_existing = code:where_is_file("kernel"), % no such file
 1086:     ok.
 1087: 
 1088: %% Test that stacktrace is deleted when purging a referred module.
 1089: purge_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1090:     run_purge_test(fun purge_stacktrace_test/1, Config).
 1091:     
 1092: purge_stacktrace_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1093:     code:purge(code_b_test),
 1094:     try code_b_test:call(fun(b) -> ok end, a)
 1095:     catch
 1096: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace ->
 1097: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1098: 	    case Stacktrace of
 1099: 		      [{?MODULE,_,[a],_},
 1100: 		       {code_b_test,call,2,_},
 1101: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1102: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1103: 		  end
 1104:     end,
 1105:     try code_b_test:call(nofun, 2)
 1106:     catch
 1107: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace2 ->
 1108: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1109: 	    case Stacktrace2 of
 1110: 		      [{code_b_test,call,[nofun,2],_},
 1111: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1112: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1113: 		  end
 1114:     end,
 1115:     Args = [erlang,error,[badarg]],
 1116:     try code_b_test:call(erlang, error, [badarg,Args])
 1117:     catch
 1118: 	error:badarg:Stacktrace3 ->
 1119: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1120: 	    case Stacktrace3 of
 1121: 		      [{code_b_test,call,Args,_},
 1122: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1123: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1124: 		  end
 1125:     end,
 1126:     ok.
 1127: 
 1128: mult_lib_roots(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1129:     DataDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mult_lib_roots"),
 1130:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-b/ebin/lists"),
 1131: 
 1132:     %% We will use this module to test both code path loading and
 1133:     %% code path caching. So we ensure its beam file does not exist.
 1134:     CodeSuiteMultRootBeam =
 1135: 	filename:join(DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1136:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1137: 
 1138:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1139:     ErlLibs = filename:join(DataDir, "first_root") ++ mult_lib_sep() ++
 1140: 	filename:join(DataDir, "second_root"),
 1141: 
 1142:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs]),
 1143: 
 1144:     Path0 = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1145:     %% ?CT_PEER adds extra path to this module folder
 1146:     PathToSelf = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1147:     [PathToSelf, "."|Path1] = Path0,
 1148:     [Kernel|Path2] = Path1,
 1149:     [Stdlib|Path3] = Path2,
 1150:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Kernel, "kernel"),
 1151:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Stdlib, "stdlib"),
 1152:     [Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5|Path] = Path3,
 1153: 
 1154: 
 1155:     ["first_root/my_dummy_app-a/ebin",
 1156:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-b/ebin",
 1157:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin",
 1158:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-d/ebin",
 1159:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-e/ebin"] =
 1160: 	[mult_lib_remove_prefix(E, DataDir) ||
 1161: 	    E <- lists:sort([Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5])],
 1162:     io:format("~p\n", [Path]),
 1163: 
 1164:     %% Now let's attempt to dynamically add a module,
 1165:     %% this will fail due to the boot paths cache.
 1166:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1167:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1168:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1169:     %% Test that the CWD is not cached
 1170:     File = filename:join([DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"]),
 1171:     {ok, _} = compile:file(File, [{outdir, "."}]),
 1172:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1173:     true = rpc:call(Node, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1174:     file:delete("code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1175:     %% Clean up so we can start again
 1176:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1177:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1178: 
 1179:     NoCacheArgs = ["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs, "-cache_boot_paths", "false"],
 1180:     {ok, NoCachePeer, NoCacheNode} = ?CT_PEER(NoCacheArgs),
 1181: 
 1182:     %% Now the same code should work
 1183:     error = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1184:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1185:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1186:     true = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1187: 
 1188:     peer:stop(NoCachePeer),
 1189:     ok.
 1190: 
 1191: mult_lib_compile(Root, Last) ->
 1192:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(Last)),
 1193:     Name = filename:join([Root,"first_root",Last]),
 1194:     Dir = filename:dirname(Name),
 1195:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Name, [report,{outdir,Dir}]),
 1196:     ok.
 1197: 
 1198: mult_lib_sep() ->
 1199:     case os:type() of
 1200: 	{win32,_} -> ";";
 1201: 	_ -> ":"
 1202:     end.
 1203: 
 1204: mult_lib_verify_lib(Path, Expected) ->
 1205:     Dir = filename:basename(filename:dirname(Path)),
 1206:     true = lists:prefix(Expected, Dir).
 1207: 
 1208: mult_lib_remove_prefix([H|T1], [H|T2]) ->
 1209:     mult_lib_remove_prefix(T1, T2);
 1210: mult_lib_remove_prefix([$/|T], []) -> T.
 1211: 
 1212: bad_erl_libs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1213:     %% Preserve ERL_LIBS if set.
 1214:     BadLibs0 = "/no/such/dir",
 1215:     BadLibs =
 1216:          case os:getenv("ERL_LIBS") of
 1217:              false -> BadLibs0;
 1218:              Libs -> BadLibs0 ++ ":" ++ Libs
 1219:          end,
 1220:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1221:     Code = rpc:call(Node,code,get_path,[]),
 1222:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1223: 
 1224:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", BadLibs]),
 1225:     Code2 = rpc:call(Node2,code,get_path,[]),
 1226:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1227:     %% Test that code path is not affected by the faulty ERL_LIBS
 1228:     Code = Code2,
 1229: 
 1230:     ok.
 1231: 
 1232: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1233: 
 1234: %% Create an archive file containing an application and make use of it.
 1235: 
 1236: code_archive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1237:     do_code_archive(Config, "code_archive_libs", false).
 1238: 
 1239: code_archive2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1240:     do_code_archive(Config, "code_archive_libs2", true).
 1241: 
 1242: do_code_archive(Config, Root, StripVsn) when is_list(Config) ->
 1243:     %% Copy the orig files to priv_dir
 1244:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1245:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1246:     App = code_archive_dict,
 1247:     VsnBase = atom_to_list(App) ++ "-1.0",
 1248:     Base =
 1249: 	case StripVsn of
 1250: 	    true  -> atom_to_list(App);
 1251: 	    false -> VsnBase
 1252: 	end,
 1253:     Ext = init:archive_extension(),
 1254:     RootDir = filename:join([PrivDir, Root]),
 1255:     ok = file:make_dir(RootDir),
 1256:     Archive = filename:join([RootDir, VsnBase ++ Ext]),
 1257:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, [VsnBase],
 1258: 			       [{compress, []}, {cwd, DataDir}]),
 1259:     {ok, _} = zip:extract(Archive, [{cwd, PrivDir}]),
 1260: 
 1261:     case StripVsn of
 1262: 	true ->
 1263: 	    ok = file:rename(filename:join([PrivDir, VsnBase]),
 1264: 				   filename:join([PrivDir, Base]));
 1265: 	false ->
 1266: 	    ok
 1267:     end,
 1268: 
 1269:     io:format("DEBUG: ~p\n", [?LINE]),
 1270:     %% Compile the code
 1271:     ok = compile_app(PrivDir, Base),
 1272: 
 1273:     %% Create the archive
 1274:     ok = file:delete(Archive),
 1275:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, [Base],
 1276: 			       [{compress, []}, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
 1277: 
 1278:     %% Create a directory and a file outside of the archive.
 1279:     OtherFile = filename:join([RootDir,VsnBase,"other","other.txt"]),
 1280:     OtherContents = ?MODULE:module_info(md5),
 1281:     filelib:ensure_dir(OtherFile),
 1282:     ok = file:write_file(OtherFile, OtherContents),
 1283: 
 1284:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1285:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", RootDir]),
 1286:     CodePath = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1287:     AppEbin = filename:join([Archive, Base, "ebin"]),
 1288:     io:format("AppEbin: ~p\n", [AppEbin]),
 1289:     io:format("CodePath: ~p\n", [CodePath]),
 1290:     io:format("Archive: ~p\n", [erl_prim_loader:read_file_info(Archive)]),
 1291:     true = lists:member(AppEbin, CodePath),
 1292: 
 1293:     %% Start the app
 1294:     ok = rpc:call(Node, application, start, [App]),
 1295: 
 1296:     %% Get the lib dir for the app.
 1297:     AppLibDir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [App]),
 1298:     io:format("AppLibDir: ~p\n", [AppLibDir]),
 1299:     AppLibDir = filename:join(RootDir, VsnBase),
 1300: 
 1301:     %% Access the app priv dir
 1302:     AppPrivDir = rpc:call(Node, code, priv_dir, [App]),
 1303:     AppPrivFile = filename:join([AppPrivDir, "code_archive.txt"]),
 1304:     io:format("AppPrivFile: ~p\n", [AppPrivFile]),
 1305:     {ok, _Bin, _} =
 1306: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [AppPrivFile]),
 1307: 
 1308:     %% Read back the other text file.
 1309:     OtherDirPath = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [App,other]),
 1310:     OtherFilePath = filename:join(OtherDirPath, "other.txt"),
 1311:     io:format("OtherFilePath: ~p\n", [OtherFilePath]),
 1312:     {ok, OtherContents, _} =
 1313: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [OtherFilePath]),
 1314: 
 1315:     %% Use the app
 1316:     Tab = code_archive_tab,
 1317:     Key = foo,
 1318:     Val = bar,
 1319:     {ok, _Pid} =  rpc:call(Node, App, new, [Tab]),
 1320:     error =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1321:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, store, [Tab, Key, Val]),
 1322:     {ok, Val} =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1323:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, erase, [Tab, Key]),
 1324:     error =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1325:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, erase, [Tab]),
 1326: 
 1327:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1328:     ok.
 1329: 
 1330: compile_app(TopDir, AppName) ->
 1331:     AppDir = filename:join([TopDir, AppName]),
 1332:     SrcDir = filename:join([AppDir, "src"]),
 1333:     OutDir = filename:join([AppDir, "ebin"]),
 1334:     {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(SrcDir),
 1335:     compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir).
 1336: 
 1337: compile_files([File | Files], SrcDir, OutDir) ->
 1338:     case filename:extension(File) of
 1339: 	".erl" ->
 1340: 	    AbsFile = filename:join([SrcDir, File]),
 1341: 	    case compile:file(AbsFile, [{outdir, OutDir}]) of
 1342: 		{ok, _Mod} ->
 1343: 		    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir);
 1344: 		Error ->
 1345: 		    {compilation_error, AbsFile, OutDir, Error}
 1346: 	    end;
 1347: 	_ ->
 1348: 	    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir)
 1349:     end;
 1350: compile_files([], _, _) ->
 1351:     ok.
 1352: 
 1353: %% Test that a boot file with (almost) all of OTP can be used to start an
 1354: %% embeddedd system.
 1355: big_boot_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1356:     {BootArg,AppsInBoot} = create_big_boot(Config),
 1357:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootArg, "-mode", "embedded"]),
 1358:     RemoteNodeApps =
 1359: 	[ {X,Y} || {X,_,Y} <-
 1360: 		       rpc:call(Node,application,loaded_applications,[]) ],
 1361:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1362:     true = lists:sort(AppsInBoot) =:=  lists:sort(RemoteNodeApps),
 1363:     ok.
 1364: 
 1365: on_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1366:     Master = on_load_test_case_process,
 1367: 
 1368:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load"]),
 1369:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1370:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1371: 
 1372:     %% Register a name for this process.
 1373:     register(Master, self()),
 1374: 
 1375:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1376: 					  exit(on_load_a:data())
 1377: 				  end),
 1378:     receive
 1379: 	{on_load_a,start} -> ok
 1380:     end,
 1381:     receive
 1382: 	{on_load_b,start} -> ok
 1383:     end,
 1384:     receive
 1385: 	{on_load_c,PidC} -> ok
 1386:     end,
 1387: 
 1388:     Refs = on_load_massive_spawn(lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1389:     receive after 7 -> ok end,
 1390: 
 1391:     PidC ! go,
 1392: 
 1393:     KernelLibDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
 1394:     receive
 1395: 	{on_load_c,done} -> ok
 1396:     end,
 1397:     receive
 1398: 	{on_load_b,done} -> ok
 1399:     end,
 1400:     receive
 1401: 	{on_load_a,KernelLibDir} -> ok
 1402:     end,
 1403: 
 1404:     receive
 1405: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Res} ->
 1406: 	    [a,b,c] = Res
 1407:     end,
 1408: 
 1409:     on_load_wait_for_all(Refs),
 1410:     receive
 1411: 	Any ->
 1412: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
 1413:     after 10 ->
 1414: 	    ok
 1415:     end.
 1416: 
 1417: on_load_massive_spawn([_|T]) ->
 1418:     {_,Ra} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [a,b,c] = on_load_a:data() end),
 1419:     {_,Rb} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [b,c] = on_load_b:data() end),
 1420:     {_,Rc} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [c] = on_load_c:data() end),
 1421:     [Ra,Rb,Rc|on_load_massive_spawn(T)];
 1422: on_load_massive_spawn([]) -> [].
 1423: 
 1424: on_load_wait_for_all([Ref|T]) ->
 1425:     receive
 1426: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,normal} ->
 1427: 	    on_load_wait_for_all(T)
 1428:     end;
 1429: on_load_wait_for_all([]) -> ok.
 1430: 
 1431: on_load_binary(_) ->
 1432:     Master = on_load_binary_test_case_process,
 1433:     register(Master, self()),
 1434: 
 1435:     %% Construct, compile and pretty-print.
 1436:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1437:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1438:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1439: 	       "-export([ok/0]).\n",
 1440: 	       "-on_load({init,0}).\n",
 1441: 	       "init() ->\n",
 1442: 	       "  '@Master@' ! {on_load_binary,self()},\n",
 1443: 	       "  receive go -> ok end.\n",
 1444: 	       "ok() -> true.\n"]),
 1445:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1446:     merl:print(Tree),
 1447: 
 1448:     {Pid1,Ref1} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1449: 					code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1450: 					true = on_load_binary:ok()
 1451: 				end),
 1452:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid} -> ok end,
 1453:     {Pid2,Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1454: 					true = on_load_binary:ok()
 1455: 				end),
 1456:     erlang:yield(),
 1457:     OnLoadPid ! go,
 1458:     receive {'DOWN',Ref1,process,Pid1,Exit1} -> ok end,
 1459:     receive {'DOWN',Ref2,process,Pid2,Exit2} -> ok end,
 1460:     normal = Exit1,
 1461:     normal = Exit2,
 1462:     true = code:delete(on_load_binary),
 1463:     false = code:purge(on_load_binary),
 1464:     ok.
 1465: 
 1466: on_load_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1467:     try
 1468: 	on_load_embedded_1(Config)
 1469:     catch
 1470: 	throw:{skip,_}=Skip ->
 1471: 	    Skip
 1472:     end.
 1473: 
 1474: on_load_embedded_1(Config) ->
 1475:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1476:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
 1477: 
 1478:     %% Link the on_load_app application into the lib directory.
 1479:     OnLoadApp = filename:join(DataDir, "on_load_app-1.0"),
 1480:     del_link(LinkName),
 1481:     io:format("LinkName :~p, OnLoadApp: ~p~n",[LinkName,OnLoadApp]),
 1482:     case file:make_symlink(OnLoadApp, LinkName) of
 1483: 	{error,enotsup} ->
 1484: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1485: 	{error,eperm} ->
 1486: 	    %% On Windows, we may not have permissions to create symlinks.
 1487: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1488: 	ok -> ok
 1489:     end,
 1490: 
 1491:     %% Compile the code.
 1492:     OnLoadAppEbin = filename:join(LinkName, "ebin"),
 1493:     {ok,_ } = compile:file(filename:join([OnLoadApp,"src",
 1494: 						"on_load_embedded"]),
 1495: 				 [{outdir,OnLoadAppEbin}]),
 1496: 
 1497:     %% Create and compile a boot file.
 1498:     true = code:add_pathz(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1499:     Options = case is_source_dir() of
 1500: 		  true -> [local];
 1501: 		  false -> []
 1502: 	      end,
 1503:     BootScript = create_boot(Config, Options),
 1504:     true = code:del_path(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1505: 
 1506:     %% Start the node and check that the on_load function was run.
 1507:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-boot", BootScript]),
 1508:     ok = rpc:call(Node, on_load_embedded, status, []),
 1509: 
 1510:     %% Clean up.
 1511:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1512: 
 1513: del_link(LinkName) ->
 1514:    case file:delete(LinkName) of
 1515:        {error,eperm} ->
 1516:              file:del_dir(LinkName);
 1517:        Other ->
 1518:        	     Other
 1519:    end.
 1520: 
 1521: create_boot(Config, Options) ->
 1522:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1523:     {LatestDir,LatestName} = create_script(Config),
 1524:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1525:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1526:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1527:     filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName).
 1528: 
 1529: create_script(Config) ->
 1530:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1531:     Name = PrivDir ++ "on_load_test",
 1532:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
 1533:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel, 1, Apps),
 1534:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib, 1, Apps),
 1535:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1536:     io:format(Fd,
 1537: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1538: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1539: 		    " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"},"
 1540: 		    " {on_load_app, \"1.0\"}]}.\n",
 1541: 		    [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
 1542:     file:close(Fd),
 1543:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name)}.
 1544: 
 1545: create_big_boot(Config) ->
 1546:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1547:     {Options,Local} = case is_source_dir() of
 1548: 				true -> {[no_module_tests,local],true};
 1549: 				_ -> {[no_module_tests],false}
 1550: 			    end,
 1551:     {LatestDir,LatestName,Apps} = create_big_script(Config,Local),
 1552:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1553:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1554:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1555:     {filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName),Apps}.
 1556: 
 1557: %% The following apps cannot be loaded.
 1558: 
 1559: %% Orber requires explicit configuration
 1560: filter_app("orber",_) -> false;
 1561: 
 1562: %% cos* depends on orber
 1563: filter_app("cos"++_,_) -> false;
 1564: 
 1565: %% ic has a mod instruction in the app file but no corresponding start
 1566: %% function
 1567: filter_app("ic",_) -> false;
 1568: 
 1569: %% Netconf has some dependency that I really do not understand (maybe
 1570: %% like orber)
 1571: filter_app("netconf",_) -> false;
 1572: 
 1573: %% Safe has the same kind of error in the .app file as ic
 1574: filter_app("safe",_) -> false;
 1575: 
 1576: %% Comte cannot be started in the "usual" way
 1577: filter_app("comte",_) -> false;
 1578: 
 1579: %% OS_mon does not find its port program when running cerl
 1580: filter_app("os_mon",true) -> false;
 1581: 
 1582: %% erts is not a "real" app either =/
 1583: filter_app("erts",_) -> false;
 1584: 
 1585: %% wx* depends on that wxwidgets libs
 1586: filter_app("wx"++_,_) -> false;
 1587: 
 1588: %% Other apps should be OK.
 1589: filter_app(_,_) -> true.
 1590: 
 1591: create_big_script(Config,Local) ->
 1592:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1593:     Name = filename:join(PrivDir,"full_script_test"),
 1594:     InitialApplications=application:loaded_applications(),
 1595:     %% Applications left loaded by the application suite, unload them!
 1596:     UnloadFix=[app0,app1,app2,group_leader,app_start_error],
 1597:     [application:unload(Leftover) ||
 1598: 	      Leftover <- UnloadFix,
 1599: 	      lists:keymember(Leftover,1,InitialApplications) ],
 1600:     %% Now we should have only "real" applications...
 1601:     [application:load(list_to_atom(Y))
 1602: 	|| {match,[Y]} <- [re:run(X,code:lib_dir()++"/"++"([^/-]*).*/ebin",
 1603: 		[{capture,[1],list},unicode]) ||
 1604: 	    X <- code:get_path()],filter_app(Y,Local)],
 1605:     Apps = [ {N,V} || {N,_,V} <- application:loaded_applications()],
 1606:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1607:     io:format(Fd,
 1608: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1609: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1610: 		    " ~p}.\n",
 1611: 		    [Apps]),
 1612:     file:close(Fd),
 1613:     NewlyLoaded =
 1614: 	application:loaded_applications() -- InitialApplications,
 1615:     [ application:unload(N) || {N,_,_} <- NewlyLoaded],
 1616:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name),Apps}.
 1617: 
 1618: is_source_dir() ->
 1619:     filename:basename(code:lib_dir(kernel)) =:= "kernel" andalso
 1620: 	filename:basename(code:lib_dir(stdlib)) =:= "stdlib".
 1621: 
 1622: on_load_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1623:     Master = on_load_error_test_case_process,
 1624:     register(Master, self()),
 1625: 
 1626:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load_errors"]),
 1627:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1628:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1629: 
 1630:     do_on_load_error(an_atom),
 1631: 
 1632:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 1633: 
 1634:     do_on_load_error({something,terrible,is,wrong}),
 1635:     receive
 1636: 	Any1 ->
 1637: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1638: 		   [on_load_error,
 1639: 		    {something,terrible,is,wrong},_]} = Any1
 1640:     end,
 1641: 
 1642:     do_on_load_error(fail),		%Cause exception.
 1643:     receive
 1644: 	Any2 ->
 1645: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1646: 		   [on_load_error,{failed,[_|_]},_]} = Any2
 1647:     end,
 1648: 
 1649:     %% There should be no more messages.
 1650:     receive
 1651: 	Unexpected ->
 1652: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1653:     after 10 ->
 1654: 	    ok
 1655:     end,
 1656: 
 1657:     %% Make sure that the code loading functions return the correct
 1658:     %% error code.
 1659:     Simple = simple_on_load_error,
 1660:     SimpleList = atom_to_list(Simple),
 1661:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_file(Simple),
 1662:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:ensure_loaded(Simple),
 1663:     {ok,SimpleCode} = file:read_file("simple_on_load_error.beam"),
 1664:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Simple, "", SimpleCode),
 1665:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList),
 1666:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList, Simple),
 1667: 
 1668:     ok.
 1669: 
 1670: do_on_load_error(ReturnValue) ->
 1671:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1672: 					  exit(on_load_error:main())
 1673: 				  end),
 1674:     receive {on_load_error,ErrorPid} -> ok end,
 1675:     ErrorPid ! ReturnValue,
 1676:     receive
 1677: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Exit} ->
 1678: 	    {undef,[{on_load_error,main,[],_}|_]} = Exit
 1679:     end.
 1680: 
 1681: on_load_update(Config) ->
 1682:     {Mod,Code1} = on_load_update_code(1),
 1683:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 1684:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1685:     100 = Mod:b(99),
 1686:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, true),
 1687: 
 1688:     {Mod,Code2} = on_load_update_code(2),
 1689:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1690:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1691:     78 = Mod:b(77),
 1692:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1693:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, false),
 1694: 
 1695:     {Mod,Code3} = on_load_update_code(3),
 1696:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code3),
 1697:     100 = Mod:c(),
 1698:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:a()),
 1699:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:b(10)),
 1700:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1701: 
 1702:     code:purge(Mod),
 1703:     code:delete(Mod),
 1704:     code:purge(Mod),
 1705:     ok.
 1706: 
 1707: on_load_update_code(Version) ->
 1708:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1709:     Tree = on_load_update_code_1(Version, Mod),
 1710:     io:format("Version ~p", [Version]),
 1711:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1712:     merl:print(Tree),
 1713:     io:nl(),
 1714:     {Mod,Code}.
 1715: 
 1716: on_load_update_code_1(1, Mod) ->
 1717:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1718: 	"-export([a/0,b/1]).\n"
 1719: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1720: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1721: 	"a() -> 42.\n"
 1722: 	"b(I) -> I+1.\n"]);
 1723: on_load_update_code_1(2, Mod) ->
 1724:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1725: 	"-export([never/0]).\n"
 1726: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1727: 	"f() -> 42 = '@Mod@':a(), 1 = '@Mod@':b(0), fail.\n",
 1728: 	"never() -> never.\n"]);
 1729: on_load_update_code_1(3, Mod) ->
 1730:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1731: 	"-export([c/0]).\n"
 1732: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1733: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1734: 	"c() -> 100.\n"]).
 1735: 
 1736: %% Test -on_load while trace feature 'on_load' is enabled (OTP-14612)
 1737: on_load_trace_on_load(Config) ->
 1738:     %% 'on_load' enables tracing for all newly loaded modules, so we make a dry
 1739:     %% run to ensure that ancillary modules like 'merl' won't be loaded during
 1740:     %% the actual test.
 1741:     on_load_update(Config),
 1742: 
 1743:     Papa = self(),
 1744:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun F() -> receive M -> Papa ! M end, F() end),
 1745:     {tracer,[]} = erlang:trace_info(self(),tracer),
 1746:     erlang:trace(self(), true, [call, {tracer, Tracer}]),
 1747:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, true, []),
 1748:     on_load_update(Config),
 1749:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, false, []),
 1750:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
 1751: 
 1752:     Ms = flush(),
 1753:     [{trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, a, []}},
 1754:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, b, [99]}},
 1755:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, c, []}}] = Ms,
 1756: 
 1757:     exit(Tracer, normal),
 1758:     ok.
 1759: 
 1760: flush() ->
 1761:     receive M -> [M | flush()]
 1762:     after 100 -> []
 1763:     end.
 1764: 
 1765: on_load_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1766:     run_purge_test(fun on_load_purge_test/1, Config).
 1767: 
 1768: on_load_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1769:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1770:     register(Mod, self()),
 1771:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1772: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1773: 	       "loop() -> loop().\n",
 1774: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1775: 	       "'@Mod@' ! {self(),spawn(fun loop/0)},\n",
 1776: 	       "receive Ack -> Ack end.\n"]),
 1777:     merl:print(Tree),
 1778:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1779:     P = spawn(fun() ->
 1780: 		      exit(code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code))
 1781: 	      end),
 1782:     monitor(process, P),
 1783:     receive
 1784: 	{Pid1,Pid2} ->
 1785: 	    monitor(process, Pid2),
 1786: 	    Pid1 ! ack_and_failure,
 1787: 	    receive
 1788: 		{'DOWN',_,process,P,Exit1} ->
 1789: 		    {error,on_load_failure} = Exit1
 1790: 	    end,
 1791: 	    receive
 1792: 		{'DOWN',_,process,Pid2,Exit2} ->
 1793: 		    io:format("~p\n", [Exit2])
 1794: 	    after 10000 ->
 1795: 		    ct:fail(no_down_message)
 1796: 	    end
 1797:     end,
 1798:     unregister(Mod),
 1799:     ok.
 1800: 
 1801: on_load_self_call(_Config) ->
 1802:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1803:     register(Mod, self()),
 1804:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1805: 	       "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1806: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1807: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1808: 	       "  '@Mod@' ! (catch '@Mod@':ext()),\n",
 1809: 	       "  ok.\n",
 1810: 	       "ext() -> good_work.\n"]),
 1811:         merl:print(Tree),
 1812:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1813: 
 1814:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1815:     good_work = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1816: 
 1817:     ok.
 1818: 
 1819: on_load_do_load(Mod, Code) ->
 1820:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1821:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1822:                end),
 1823:     receive
 1824: 	Any -> Any
 1825:     end.
 1826: 
 1827: on_load_pending(_Config) ->
 1828:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1829:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1830: 		"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1831: 		"f() ->\n",
 1832: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 1833: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1834:     merl:print(Tree1),
 1835:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 1836: 
 1837:     Tree2 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1838: 		"-export([t/0]).\n",
 1839: 		"t() -> ok.\n"]),
 1840:     merl:print(Tree2),
 1841:     {ok,Mod,Code2} = merl:compile(Tree2),
 1842: 
 1843:     Self = self(),
 1844:     {_,Ref1} =
 1845: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1846: 			      Self ! started1,
 1847: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1)
 1848: 		      end),
 1849:     receive started1 -> ok end,
 1850:     timer:sleep(10),
 1851:     {_,Ref2} =
 1852: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1853: 			      Self ! started2,
 1854: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1855: 			      ok = Mod:t()
 1856: 		      end),
 1857:     receive started2 -> ok end,
 1858:     receive
 1859: 	Unexpected ->
 1860: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1861:     after 100 ->
 1862: 	    ok
 1863:     end,
 1864:     Mod ! go,
 1865:     receive
 1866: 	{'DOWN',Ref1,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1867:     end,
 1868:     receive
 1869: 	{'DOWN',Ref2,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1870:     end,
 1871:     ok = Mod:t(),
 1872:     ok.
 1873: 
 1874: on_load_deleted(_Config) ->
 1875:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1876: 
 1877:     R0 = fun() ->
 1878: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1879: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1880: 			    "f() -> ok.\n"]),
 1881: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1882: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1883: 		 {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1884: 	 end,
 1885:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1886:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1887: 
 1888:     R1 = fun() ->
 1889: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1890: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1891: 			    "f() -> fail.\n"]),
 1892: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1893: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1894: 		 {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1895: 	 end,
 1896:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1897:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1898: 
 1899:     OtherMod = list_to_atom(lists:concat([Mod,"_42"])),
 1900:     OtherTree = ?Q(["-module('@OtherMod@').\n"]),
 1901:     merl:print(OtherTree),
 1902:     {ok,OtherMod,OtherCode} = merl:compile(OtherTree),
 1903: 
 1904:     R2 = fun() ->
 1905: 		 RegName = 'on_load__registered_name',
 1906: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1907: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1908: 			    "f() ->\n",
 1909: 			    "  register('@RegName@', self()),\n",
 1910: 			    "  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1911: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1912: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1913: 		 spawn_link(fun() ->
 1914:                                     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1915:                             end),
 1916: 		 receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1917: 		 {module,OtherMod} = code:load_binary(OtherMod, "",
 1918: 						      OtherCode),
 1919: 		 RegName ! stop
 1920: 	 end,
 1921:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R2),
 1922: 
 1923:     ok.
 1924: 
 1925: on_load_deadlock(Config) ->
 1926:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1927:     register(Mod, self()),
 1928:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1929:                "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1930:                "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1931:                "f() ->\n",
 1932:                "  timer:sleep(1000),\n",
 1933:                "  '@Mod@':ext().\n",
 1934:                "ext() -> ok.\n"]),
 1935:     merl:print(Tree),
 1936:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1937: 
 1938:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1939:     File = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam"),
 1940:     ok = file:write_file(File, Code),
 1941:     code:add_path(Dir),
 1942: 
 1943:     spawn(fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(Mod) end),
 1944:     {error,Reason} = code:ensure_loaded(Mod),
 1945:     true = (Reason =:= deadlock) or (Reason =:= on_load_failure),
 1946: 
 1947:     code:del_path(Dir),
 1948:     ok.
 1949: 
 1950: delete_before_reload(Mod, Reload) ->
 1951:     false = check_old_code(Mod),
 1952: 
 1953:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1954: 		"-export([f/1]).\n",
 1955: 		"f(Parent) ->\n",
 1956: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 1957: 		"  Parent ! started,\n",
 1958: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1959:     merl:print(Tree1),
 1960:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 1961: 
 1962:     Self = self(),
 1963:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1964:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 1965:                        Mod:f(Self)
 1966:                end),
 1967:     receive started -> ok end,
 1968: 
 1969:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1970:     true = check_old_code(Mod),
 1971: 
 1972:     Reload(),
 1973: 
 1974:     %% When loading the the module with the -on_load() function,
 1975:     %% the reference to the old code would be lost. Make sure that
 1976:     %% the old code is remembered and is still preventing the
 1977:     %% purge.
 1978:     false = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1979: 
 1980:     %% Get rid of the old code.
 1981:     Mod ! stop,
 1982:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1983:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1984: 
 1985:     %% Unload the version of the module with the -on_load() function.
 1986:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1987:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1988: 
 1989:     ok.
 1990: 
 1991: %% Test that the mode of the code server is properly retrieved.
 1992: get_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1993:     interactive = code:get_mode().
 1994: 
 1995: %% Make sure that the paths for all loaded modules have been normalized.
 1996: normalized_paths(_Config) ->
 1997:     do_normalized_paths(erlang:loaded()).
 1998: 
 1999: do_normalized_paths([M|Ms]) ->
 2000:     case code:which(M) of
 2001: 	Special when is_atom(Special) ->
 2002: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms);
 2003: 	File when is_list(File) ->
 2004: 	    File = filename:join([File]),
 2005: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms)
 2006:     end;
 2007: do_normalized_paths([]) ->
 2008:     ok.
 2009: 
 2010: %% Make sure that the extra -mode flags are ignored
 2011: mult_embedded_flags(_Config) ->
 2012:     Modes = [{["-mode", "embedded"], embedded},
 2013: 	     {["-mode", "interactive"], interactive},
 2014: 	     {["-mode", "invalid"], interactive}],
 2015: 
 2016:     [ begin
 2017: 	  {ArgMode, ExpectedMode} = Mode,
 2018: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgMode),
 2019: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 2020: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 2021:       end || Mode <- Modes],
 2022: 
 2023:     [ begin
 2024: 	  {ArgIgnoredMode, _} = IgnoredMode,
 2025: 	  {ArgRelevantMode, ExpectedMode} = RelevantMode,
 2026: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgRelevantMode ++ ArgIgnoredMode),
 2027: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 2028: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 2029:       end || IgnoredMode <- Modes, RelevantMode <- Modes],
 2030:     ok.
 2031: 
 2032: %% Test that module_status/1 behaves as expected
 2033: module_status(_Config) ->
 2034:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 2035:         true ->
 2036:             module_status();
 2037:         false ->
 2038:             %% Make sure that we terminate the cover server.
 2039:             try
 2040:                 module_status()
 2041:             after
 2042:                 cover:stop()
 2043:             end
 2044:     end.
 2045: 
 2046: module_status() ->
 2047:     %% basics
 2048:     not_loaded = code:module_status(fubar),     % nonexisting
 2049:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(erlang),
 2050:     loaded = code:module_status(erlang),        % preloaded
 2051:     loaded = code:module_status(?MODULE),       % normal known loaded
 2052: 
 2053:     %% module_status/0 returns status for each loaded module
 2054:     true = (lists:sort([{M, code:module_status(M)}
 2055:                         || {M, _} <- code:all_loaded()])
 2056:             =:= lists:sort(code:module_status())),
 2057:
