 2058:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
 2059:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
 2060:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2061:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2062: 
 2063:     %% generated code is detected as such
 2064:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
 2065:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_binary(?TESTMOD,"",Bin),  % no source file
 2066:     ok = ?TESTMOD:f(),
 2067:     "" = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify empty string for source file
 2068:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2069: 
 2070:     %% module_status/1 also accepts a list of modules
 2071:     [] = code:module_status([]),
 2072:     [{erlang, loaded},{?MODULE,loaded},{?TESTMOD,loaded}] =
 2073:         code:module_status([erlang, ?MODULE, ?TESTMOD]),
 2074: 
 2075:     %% deleting generated code
 2076:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2077:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify still not in path
 2078:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2079: 
 2080:     %% beam file exists but not loaded
 2081:     make_source_file(<<"0">>),
 2082:     compile_beam(0),
 2083:     true = (non_existing =/= code:which(?TESTMOD)), % verify in path
 2084:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2085: 
 2086:     %% loading code from disk makes it loaded
 2087:     load_code(),
 2088:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded
 2089: 
 2090:     %% cover compiling a module
 2091:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = cover:compile(?TESTMOD),
 2092:     {file, cover_compiled} = code:is_loaded(?TESTMOD), % verify cover compiled
 2093:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded cover code but file exists
 2094:     remove_code(),
 2095:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % removed
 2096:     compile_beam(0),
 2097:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % recreated
 2098:     load_code(),
 2099:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loading removes cover status
 2100:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2101:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2102:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % deleted
 2103: 
 2104:     %% recompilation ignores timestamps, only md5 matters
 2105:     load_code(),
 2106:     compile_beam(1100),
 2107:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2108: 
 2109:     %% modifying module detects different md5
 2110:     make_source_file(<<"1">>),
 2111:     compile_beam(0),
 2112:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2113: 
 2114:     %% loading the modified code from disk makes it loaded
 2115:     load_code(),
 2116:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2117: 
 2118:     %% removing and recreating a module with same md5
 2119:     remove_code(),
 2120:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2121:     compile_beam(0),
 2122:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2123: 
 2124:     ok.
 2125: 
 2126: compile_beam(Sleep) ->
 2127:     compile(Sleep, []).
 2128: 
 2129: compile(Sleep, Opts) ->
 2130:     timer:sleep(Sleep),  % increment compilation timestamp
 2131:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = compile:file(?TESTMODSRC, Opts).
 2132: 
 2133: load_code() ->
 2134:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2135:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_file(?TESTMOD).
 2136: 
 2137: remove_code() ->
 2138:     ok = file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ).
 2139: 
 2140: make_source_file(Body) ->
 2141:     ok = file:write_file(?TESTMODSRC, dummy_source(Body)).
 2142: 
 2143: dummy_source(Body) ->
 2144:     [<<"-module(" ?TESTMODSTR ").\n"
 2145:        "-export([f/0]).\n"
 2146:        "f() -> ">>, Body, <<".\n">>].
 2147: 
 2148: dummy_ast() ->
 2149:     dummy_ast(?TESTMODSTR).
 2150: 
 2151: dummy_ast(Mod) when is_atom(Mod) ->
 2152:     dummy_ast(atom_to_list(Mod));
 2153: dummy_ast(ModStr) ->
 2154:     [scan_form("-module(" ++ ModStr ++ ")."),
 2155:      scan_form("-export([f/0])."),
 2156:      scan_form("f() -> ok.")].
 2157: 
 2158: scan_form(String) ->
 2159:     {ok,Ts,_} = erl_scan:string(String),
 2160:     {ok,F} = erl_parse:parse_form(Ts),
 2161:     F.
 2162: 
 2163: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2164: %% error_logger handler.
 2165: %% (Copied from stdlib/test/proc_lib_SUITE.erl.)
 2166: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2167: init(Tester) ->
 2168:     {ok, Tester}.
 2169: 
 2170: handle_event({warning_msg, _GL, Msg}, Tester) ->
 2171:     Tester ! Msg,
 2172:     {ok, Tester};
 2173: handle_event(_Event, State) ->
 2174:     {ok, State}.
 2175: 
 2176: handle_info(_, State) ->
 2177:     {ok, State}.
 2178: 
 2179: handle_call(_Query, State) -> {ok, {error, bad_query}, State}.
 2180: 
 2181: terminate(_Reason, State) ->
 2182:     State.
 2183: 
 2184: %%%
 2185: %%% Common utility functions.
 2186: %%%
 2187: 
 2188: run_purge_test(Test, Config) ->
 2189:     OSRL = erlang:system_info(outstanding_system_requests_limit),
 2190:     
 2191:     TestLowOSRL = case OSRL < 10 of
 2192:                       true -> 1;
 2193:                       false -> 5
 2194:                   end,
 2195: 
 2196:     io:format("Running with the default outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [OSRL]),
 2197:     Res1 = Test(Config),
 2198:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res1]),
 2199:     try
 2200:         %% Run again with low limit and many processes...
 2201:         Procs = case erlang:system_info(process_limit) of
 2202:                     PLim when PLim < 20000 ->
 2203:                         erlang:system_info(process_limit) div 2;
 2204:                     _ ->
 2205:                         10000
 2206:                 end,
 2207:         erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, TestLowOSRL),
 2208:         io:format("Running with outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [TestLowOSRL]),
 2209:         Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2210:                                spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end)
 2211:                        end, lists:seq(1, Procs)),
 2212:         Res2 = Test(Config),
 2213:         lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 2214:                               unlink(P),
 2215:                               exit(P, kill)
 2216:                       end, Ps),
 2217:         lists:foreach(fun (P) -> is_process_alive(P) end, Ps),
 2218:         io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res2]),
 2219:         {Res1, Res2}
 2220:     after
 2221:         TestLowOSRL = erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, OSRL)
 2222:     end.
